refnamediv.refpurpose: proxy object for a Telepathy connection manager

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "always-introspect" gboolean : Read / Write "connection-manager" gchar* : Read "info-source" guint : Read "manager-file" gchar* : Read / Write / Construct

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "activated" : Run Last / Has Details "exited" : Run Last / Has Details "got-info" : Run Last / Has Details

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: TpConnectionManager objects represent Telepathy connection managers. They can be used to open connections.

refsect2.title: TpConnectionManagerListCb ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*TpConnectionManagerListCb) (TpConnectionManager * const *cms, gsize n_cms, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback supplied to tp_list_connection_managers().

Since 0.7.26, tp_list_connection_managers() will wait for each TpConnectionManager to become ready, so all connection managers passed to callback will be ready (tp_connection_manager_is_ready() will return TRUE) unless an error occurred while launching that connection manager.

listitem.simpara: NULL-terminated array of TpConnectionManager (the objects will be unreferenced and the array will be freed after the callback returns, so the callback must reference any CMs it stores a pointer to), or NULL on error
number of connection managers in cms (not including the final NULL)
NULL on success, or an error that occurred
user-supplied data
user-supplied weakly referenced object

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_list_connection_managers ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_list_connection_managers (TpDBusDaemon *bus_daemon, TpConnectionManagerListCb callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: List the available (running or installed) connection managers. Call the callback when done.

Since 0.7.26, this function will wait for each TpConnectionManager to be ready, so all connection managers passed to callback will be ready (tp_connection_manager_is_ready() will return TRUE) unless an error occurred while launching that connection manager.

listitem.simpara: proxy for the D-Bus daemon
callback to be called when listing the CMs succeeds or fails; not called if the weak_object goes away
user-supplied data for the callback
callback to destroy the user-supplied data, called after callback, but also if the weak_object goes away
if not NULL, will be weakly referenced; the callback will not be called, and the call will be cancelled, if the object has vanished

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: TpConnectionManager
refsect2.para: A proxy object for a Telepathy connection manager.

This might represent a connection manager which is currently running (in which case it can be introspected) or not (in which case its capabilities can be read from .manager files in the filesystem). Accordingly, this object never emits "invalidated" unless all references to it are discarded.
Various fields and methods on this object do not work until tp_connection_manager_is_ready() returns TRUE. Use tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready() to wait for this to happen.

listitem.simpara: The parent class instance
The identifier of the connection manager (e.g. "gabble"). Should be considered read-only
If info_source > TP_CM_INFO_SOURCE_NONE, a NULL-terminated array of pointers to TpConnectionManagerProtocol structures; otherwise NULL. Should be considered read-only
TRUE if the CM is currently known to be running. Should be considered read-only
TRUE if the CM will be introspected automatically. Should be considered read-only: use the "always-introspect" property if you want to change it
The source of protocols, or TP_CM_INFO_SOURCE_NONE if no info has been discovered yet
Reserved for future use
Pointer to opaque private data

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: TpConnectionManagerClass
refsect2.para: The class of a TpConnectionManager.
Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpConnectionManager * tp_connection_manager_new (TpDBusDaemon *dbus, const gchar *name, const gchar *manager_filename, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Convenience function to create a new connection manager proxy. If its protocol and parameter information are required, you should call tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready() on the result.

listitem.simpara: Proxy for the D-Bus daemon
The connection manager name (such as "gabble")
The "manager-file" property, which may (and generally should) be NULL.
used to return an error if NULL is returned
a new reference to a connection manager proxy, or NULL if error is set.

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Return the internal name of this connection manager in the Telepathy D-Bus API, e.g. "gabble" or "haze". This is often the name of the binary without the "telepathy-" prefix.
The returned string is valid as long as self is. Copy it with g_strdup() if a longer lifetime is required.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
the "connection-manager" property

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: TpConnectionManagerWhenReadyCb ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*TpConnectionManagerWhenReadyCb) (TpConnectionManager *cm, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Called as the result of tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready(). If the connection manager's protocol and parameter information could be retrieved, error is NULL and cm is considered to be ready. Otherwise, error is non-NULL and cm is not ready.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
NULL on success, or the reason why tp_connection_manager_is_ready() would return FALSE
the user_data passed to tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready()
the weak_object passed to tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready()

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready (TpConnectionManager *self, TpConnectionManagerWhenReadyCb callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Call the callback from the main loop when information about cm's supported protocols and parameters has been retrieved.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
callback to call when information has been retrieved or on error
arbitrary data to pass to the callback
called to destroy user_data
object to reference weakly; if it is destroyed, callback will not be called, but destroy will still be called

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_is_ready ()
refsect2.para: If protocol and parameter information has been obtained from the connection manager or the cache in the .manager file, return TRUE. Otherwise, return FALSE.
This may change from FALSE to TRUE at any time that the main loop is running; the "notify" signal is emitted for the "info-source" property.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
TRUE, unless the "info-source" property is TP_CM_INFO_SOURCE_NONE

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: enum TpCMInfoSource
refsect2.para: Describes possible sources of information on connection managers' supported protocols.

listitem.simpara: no information available
information came from a .manager file
information came from the connection manager

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_get_info_source ()
refsect2.para: If protocol and parameter information has been obtained from the connection manager, return TP_CM_INFO_SOURCE_LIVE; if it has been obtained from the cache in the .manager file, return TP_CM_INFO_SOURCE_FILE. If this information has not yet been obtained, or obtaining it failed, return TP_CM_INFO_SOURCE_NONE.
This may increase at any time that the main loop is running; the "notify" signal is emitted.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
the value of the "info-source" property

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_activate ()
refsect2.para: Attempt to run and introspect the connection manager, asynchronously. Since 0.7.26 this function is not generally very useful, since the connection manager will now be activated automatically if necessary.
If the CM was already running, do nothing and return FALSE.
On success, emit "activated" when the CM appears on the bus, and "got-info" when its capabilities have been (re-)discovered.
On failure, emit "exited" without first emitting activated.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager proxy
TRUE if activation was needed and is now in progress, FALSE if the connection manager was already running and no additional signals will be emitted.

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_is_running ()
refsect2.para: Return TRUE if this connection manager currently appears to be running. This may change at any time that the main loop is running; the "activated" and "exited" signals are emitted.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
whether the connection manager is currently running

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_dup_protocol_names ()
refsect2.para: Returns a list of protocol names supported by this connection manager. These are the internal protocol names used by the Telepathy specification (e.g. "jabber" and "msn"), rather than user-visible names in any particular locale.
If this function is called before the connection manager information has been obtained, the result is always NULL. Use tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready() to wait for this.
The result is copied and must be freed by the caller, but it is not necessarily still true after the main loop is re-entered.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
a GStrv of protocol names

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_has_protocol ()
refsect2.para: Return whether protocol is supported by this connection manager.
If this function is called before the connection manager information has been obtained, the result is always FALSE. Use tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready() to wait for this.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
the name of a protocol as defined in the Telepathy D-Bus API, e.g. "jabber" or "msn"
TRUE if this connection manager supports protocol

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_get_protocol ()
refsect2.para: Returns a structure representing a protocol, or NULL if this connection manager does not support the specified protocol.
If this function is called before the connection manager information has been obtained, the result is always NULL. Use tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready() to wait for this.
The result is not necessarily valid after the main loop is re-entered.

listitem.simpara: a connection manager
the name of a protocol as defined in the Telepathy D-Bus API, e.g. "jabber" or "msn"
a structure representing the protocol

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: TpConnectionManagerProtocol
refsect2.para: Structure representing a protocol supported by a connection manager. Note that the size of this structure may change, so its size must not be relied on.

listitem.simpara: The name of this connection manager
Array of TpConnectionManagerParam structures, terminated by a structure whose name is NULL

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_protocol_can_register ()
refsect2.para: Return whether a new account can be registered on this protocol, by setting the special "register" parameter to TRUE.

listitem.simpara: structure representing a supported protocol
TRUE if protocol supports the parameter "register"

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_protocol_dup_param_names ()
refsect2.para: Returns a list of parameter names supported by this connection manager for this protocol.
The result is copied and must be freed by the caller with g_strfreev().

listitem.simpara: a protocol supported by a TpConnectionManager
a GStrv of protocol names

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_protocol_has_param ()

listitem.simpara: structure representing a supported protocol
a parameter name
TRUE if protocol supports the parameter param.

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_protocol_get_param ()

listitem.simpara: structure representing a supported protocol
a parameter name
a structure representing the parameter param, or NULL if not supported

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: TpConnectionManagerParam
refsect2.para: Structure representing a connection manager parameter.

listitem.simpara: The name of this parameter
This parameter's D-Bus signature

This parameter's default value, or an arbitrary value of an appropriate type if TP_CONN_MGR_PARAM_FLAG_HAS_DEFAULT is not set on this parameter, or an unset GValue if the signature is not recognised by telepathy-glib
This parameter's flags (a combination of TpConnMgrParamFlags)
Pointer to opaque private data

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_param_get_name ()

listitem.simpara: a parameter supported by a TpConnectionManager
the name of the parameter

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_param_get_dbus_signature ()

listitem.simpara: a parameter supported by a TpConnectionManager
the D-Bus signature of the parameter

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_param_is_required ()

listitem.simpara: a parameter supported by a TpConnectionManager
TRUE if the parameter is normally required

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_param_is_required_for_registration ()

listitem.simpara: a parameter supported by a TpConnectionManager
TRUE if the parameter is required when registering a new account (by setting the special "register" parameter to TRUE)

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_param_is_secret ()

listitem.simpara: a parameter supported by a TpConnectionManager
TRUE if the parameter's value is a password or other secret

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_param_is_dbus_property ()

listitem.simpara: a parameter supported by a TpConnectionManager
TRUE if the parameter represents a D-Bus property of the same name

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_param_get_default ()
refsect2.para: Get the default value for this parameter, if there is one. If FALSE is returned, value is left uninitialized.

listitem.simpara: a parameter supported by a TpConnectionManager
pointer to an unset (all zeroes) GValue into which the default's type and value are written
TRUE if there is a default value

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.26

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_check_valid_name ()
refsect2.para: Check that the given string is a valid connection manager name, i.e. that it consists entirely of ASCII letters, digits and underscores, and starts with a letter.

listitem.simpara: a possible connection manager name
used to raise TP_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT if FALSE is returned
TRUE if name is valid

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_check_valid_protocol_name ()
refsect2.para: Check that the given string is a valid protocol name, i.e. that it consists entirely of ASCII letters, digits and hyphen/minus, and starts with a letter.

listitem.simpara: a possible protocol name
used to raise TP_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT if FALSE is returned
TRUE if name is valid

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_connection_manager_init_known_interfaces ()
refsect2.para: Ensure that the known interfaces for TpConnectionManager have been set up. This is done automatically when necessary, but for correct overriding of library interfaces by local extensions, you should call this function before calling tp_proxy_or_subclass_hook_on_interface_add() with first argument TP_TYPE_CONNECTION_MANAGER.
Since 0.7.32

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_get_parameters ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_get_parameters) (TpConnectionManager *proxy, const GPtrArray *out_Parameters, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a GetParameters method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
Used to return an 'out' argument if error is NULL: <tp:docstring xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> An array of structs representing possible parameters.
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_call_get_parameters ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_connection_manager_call_get_parameters (TpConnectionManager *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const gchar *in_Protocol, tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_get_parameters callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a GetParameters method call.

Get a list of the parameters which must or may be provided to the <tp:member-ref>RequestConnection</tp:member-ref> method when connecting to the given protocol, or registering (the boolean "register" parameter is available, and set to true).

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: The required protocol name
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_run_get_parameters ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_connection_manager_run_get_parameters (TpConnectionManager *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const gchar *in_Protocol, GPtrArray **out_Parameters, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method GetParameters and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.

Get a list of the parameters which must or may be provided to the <tp:member-ref>RequestConnection</tp:member-ref> method when connecting to the given protocol, or registering (the boolean "register" parameter is available, and set to true).

listitem.simpara: A TpConnectionManager or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: The required protocol name
Used to return an 'out' argument if TRUE is returned: <tp:docstring xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> An array of structs representing possible parameters.
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_list_protocols ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_list_protocols) (TpConnectionManager *proxy, const gchar **out_Protocols, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a ListProtocols method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
Used to return an 'out' argument if error is NULL: A array of string protocol identifiers supported by this manager
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_call_list_protocols ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_connection_manager_call_list_protocols (TpConnectionManager *proxy, gint timeout_ms, tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_list_protocols callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a ListProtocols method call.
Get a list of protocol identifiers that are implemented by this connection manager.

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_run_list_protocols ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_connection_manager_run_list_protocols (TpConnectionManager *proxy, gint timeout_ms, gchar ***out_Protocols, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method ListProtocols and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.
Get a list of protocol identifiers that are implemented by this connection manager.

listitem.simpara: A TpConnectionManager or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to return an 'out' argument if TRUE is returned: A array of string protocol identifiers supported by this manager
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_request_connection ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_request_connection) (TpConnectionManager *proxy, const gchar *out_Bus_Name, const gchar *out_Object_Path, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a RequestConnection method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
Used to return an 'out' argument if error is NULL: A D-Bus service name where the new Connection object can be found
Used to return an 'out' argument if error is NULL: The D-Bus object path to the Connection on this service
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_call_request_connection ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_connection_manager_call_request_connection (TpConnectionManager *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const gchar *in_Protocol, GHashTable *in_Parameters, tp_cli_connection_manager_callback_for_request_connection callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a RequestConnection method call.

Request a Connection object representing a given account on a given protocol with the given parameters. The method returns the bus name and the object path where the new Connection object can be found, which should have the status of Connection_Status_Disconnected, to allow signal handlers to be attached before connecting is started with the Connect method.

The parameters which must and may be provided in the parameters dictionary can be discovered with the GetParameters method. These parameters, their types, and their default values may be cached in files so that all available connection managers do not need to be started to discover which protocols are available.

To request values for these parameters from the user, a client must have prior knowledge of the meaning of the parameter names, so the following well-known names and types should be used where appropriate:

account (s)
The identifier for the user's account on the server
server (s)
A fully qualified domain name or numeric IPv4 or IPv6 address. Using the fully-qualified domain name form is recommended whenever possible. If this parameter is specified and the account for that protocol also specifies a server, this parameter should override that in the user id.
port (q)
A TCP or UDP port number. If this parameter is specified and the account for that protocol also specifies a port, this parameter should override that in the account.
password (s)
A password associated with the account.
require-encryption (b)
Require encryption for this connection. A connection should fail to connect if require-encryption is set and an encrypted connection is not possible.
register (b)
This account should be created on the server if it does not already exist.
ident (s)
The local username to report to the server if necessary, such as in IRC.
fullname (s)
The user's full name if the service requires this when authenticating or registering.
stun-server (s)
The IP address or FQDN of a STUN server to use for NAT traversal, without any ":port" suffix.
stun-port (q)
The UDP port number on the stun-server to use for STUN. Only significant if the stun-server is also supplied.
keepalive-interval (u)
The time in seconds between pings sent to the server to ensure that the connection is still alive, or 0 to disable such pings.

Every successful RequestConnection call will cause the emission of a NewConnection signal for the same newly created connection. The requester can use the returned object path and service name independently of the emission of that signal. In that case this signal emission is most useful for, e.g. other processes that are monitoring the creation of new connections.

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: The protocol identifier
Used to pass an 'in' argument: A dictionary mapping parameter names to values of the appropriate type, as indicated by <tp:member-ref>GetParameters</tp:member-ref> and the above well-known list.
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_run_request_connection ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_connection_manager_run_request_connection (TpConnectionManager *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const gchar *in_Protocol, GHashTable *in_Parameters, gchar **out_Bus_Name, gchar **out_Object_Path, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method RequestConnection and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.

Request a Connection object representing a given account on a given protocol with the given parameters. The method returns the bus name and the object path where the new Connection object can be found, which should have the status of Connection_Status_Disconnected, to allow signal handlers to be attached before connecting is started with the Connect method.

The parameters which must and may be provided in the parameters dictionary can be discovered with the GetParameters method. These parameters, their types, and their default values may be cached in files so that all available connection managers do not need to be started to discover which protocols are available.

To request values for these parameters from the user, a client must have prior knowledge of the meaning of the parameter names, so the following well-known names and types should be used where appropriate:

account (s)
The identifier for the user's account on the server
server (s)
A fully qualified domain name or numeric IPv4 or IPv6 address. Using the fully-qualified domain name form is recommended whenever possible. If this parameter is specified and the account for that protocol also specifies a server, this parameter should override that in the user id.
port (q)
A TCP or UDP port number. If this parameter is specified and the account for that protocol also specifies a port, this parameter should override that in the account.
password (s)
A password associated with the account.
require-encryption (b)
Require encryption for this connection. A connection should fail to connect if require-encryption is set and an encrypted connection is not possible.
register (b)
This account should be created on the server if it does not already exist.
ident (s)
The local username to report to the server if necessary, such as in IRC.
fullname (s)
The user's full name if the service requires this when authenticating or registering.
stun-server (s)
The IP address or FQDN of a STUN server to use for NAT traversal, without any ":port" suffix.
stun-port (q)
The UDP port number on the stun-server to use for STUN. Only significant if the stun-server is also supplied.
keepalive-interval (u)
The time in seconds between pings sent to the server to ensure that the connection is still alive, or 0 to disable such pings.

Every successful RequestConnection call will cause the emission of a NewConnection signal for the same newly created connection. The requester can use the returned object path and service name independently of the emission of that signal. In that case this signal emission is most useful for, e.g. other processes that are monitoring the creation of new connections.

listitem.simpara: A TpConnectionManager or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: The protocol identifier
Used to pass an 'in' argument: A dictionary mapping parameter names to values of the appropriate type, as indicated by <tp:member-ref>GetParameters</tp:member-ref> and the above well-known list.
Used to return an 'out' argument if TRUE is returned: A D-Bus service name where the new Connection object can be found
Used to return an 'out' argument if TRUE is returned: The D-Bus object path to the Connection on this service
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_signal_callback_new_connection ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_connection_manager_signal_callback_new_connection) (TpConnectionManager *proxy, const gchar *arg_Bus_Name, const gchar *arg_Object_Path, const gchar *arg_Protocol, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Represents the signature of a callback for the signal NewConnection.

listitem.simpara: The proxy on which tp_cli_connection_manager_connect_to_new_connection() was called
The D-Bus service where the connection object can be found
The object path of the Connection object on this service
The identifier for the protocol this connection uses
User-supplied data
User-supplied weakly referenced object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_connection_manager_connect_to_new_connection ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxySignalConnection * tp_cli_connection_manager_connect_to_new_connection (TpConnectionManager *proxy, tp_cli_connection_manager_signal_callback_new_connection callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal NewConnection.
Emitted when a new <tp:dbus-ref namespace="org.freedesktop.Telepathy">Connection</tp:dbus-ref> object is created.

listitem.simpara: A TpConnectionManager or subclass
Callback to be called when the signal is received
User-supplied data for the callback
Destructor for the user-supplied data, which will be called when this signal is disconnected, or before this function returns NULL
If not NULL, used to raise an error if NULL is returned
a TpProxySignalConnection containing all of the above, which can be used to disconnect the signal; or NULL if the proxy does not have the desired interface or has become invalid.

refsect2.title: The "always-introspect" property
refsect2.para: If TRUE, always introspect the connection manager as it comes online, even if we already have its info from a .manager file. Default FALSE.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "connection-manager" property
refsect2.para: The name of the connection manager, e.g. "gabble" (read-only).
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "info-source" property
refsect2.para: Where we got the current information on supported protocols (a TpCMInfoSource).
Since 0.7.26, the "notify" signal is emitted for this property.
Allowed values: <= 2
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "manager-file" property
refsect2.para: The absolute path of the .manager file. If set to NULL (the default), the XDG data directories will be searched for a .manager file of the correct name.
If set to the empty string, no .manager file will be read.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "activated" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (TpConnectionManager *self, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Has Details
refsect2.para: Emitted when the connection manager's well-known name appears on the bus.

listitem.simpara: the connection manager proxy
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "exited" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (TpConnectionManager *self, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Has Details
refsect2.para: Emitted when the connection manager's well-known name disappears from the bus or when activation fails.

listitem.simpara: the connection manager proxy
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "got-info" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (TpConnectionManager *self, guint source, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Has Details
refsect2.para: Emitted when the connection manager's capabilities have been discovered.
This signal is not very helpful. Since 0.7.26, using tp_connection_manager_call_when_ready() instead is recommended.

listitem.simpara: the connection manager proxy
a TpCMInfoSource
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
